name: Deception
text: Target opponent discards two cards.

editions.flavor: Believing they wrote the forged letter that had been stolen from Zhou Yu, Cao Cao rashly executed his two best admirals for treason.

name: Decimate
text: Destroy target artifact, target creature, target enchantment, and target land.

editions.flavor:
"Anyone can admire creation. Only a barbarian sees the beauty in demolition."
—Kamahl, pit fighter
Anarchy comes in many forms: social, individual, Gruul . . .
Anarchy comes in many forms: social, individual, Gruul . . .

name: Decimator of the Provinces
text:
Emerge {6}{G}{G}{G} (You may cast this spell by sacrificing a creature and paying the emerge cost reduced by that creature's converted mana cost.)
When you cast Decimator of the Provinces, creatures you control get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.
Trample, haste

name: Decimator Web
text: {4}, {T}: Target opponent loses 2 life, gets a poison counter, then puts the top six cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: Mycosynth grew unfettered beneath the black lacuna, metastasizing into a matrix of noxious energy.

name: Declaration in Stone
text: Exile target creature and all other creatures its controller controls with the same name as that creature. That player investigates for each nontoken creature exiled this way.

editions.flavor: The message was clear to Sorin—Nahiri had paid Markov Manor a visit.

name: Declaration of Naught
text:
As Declaration of Naught enters the battlefield, name a card.
{U}: Counter target spell with the chosen name.

editions.flavor: Every story, even a faerie tale, comes to an end.

name: Decoction Module
text:
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you get {E} (an energy counter).
{4}, {T}: Return target creature you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Progress leads to inspiration.

name: Decommission
text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Revolt — If a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: "A key weakness in the design is its vulnerability to repeated, forceful blows."

name: Decompose
text: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Sheesh! How am I supposed to make a decent living around here?"
—Cabal grave robber

"Sheesh! How am I supposed to make a decent living around here?"
—Cabal grave robber

name: Decomposition
text:
Enchant black creature
Enchanted creature has "Cumulative upkeep—Pay 1 life." (At the beginning of its controller's upkeep, that player puts an age counter on it, then sacrifices it unless he or she pays its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When enchanted creature dies, its controller loses 2 life.

name: Deconstruct
text: Destroy target artifact. Add {G}{G}{G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "Nothing in this world, not even magic, likes to be caged."

name: Decorated Griffin
text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Prevent the next 1 combat damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

editions.flavor: The awards and medals of polis-dwellers mean nothing to griffins, but they repay acts of generosity.

name: Decree of Annihilation
text:
Exile all artifacts, creatures, and lands from the battlefield, all cards from all graveyards, and all cards from all hands.
Cycling {5}{R}{R} ({5}{R}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Annihilation, destroy all lands.

name: Decree of Justice
text:
Create X 4/4 white Angel creature tokens with flying.
Cycling {2}{W} ({2}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Justice, you may pay {X}. If you do, create X 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.

name: Decree of Pain
text:
Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.
Cycling {3}{B}{B} ({3}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Pain, all creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

name: Decree of Savagery
text:
Put four +1/+1 counters on each creature you control.
Cycling {4}{G}{G} ({4}{G}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Savagery, you may put four +1/+1 counters on target creature.

name: Decree of Silence
text:
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, counter that spell and put a depletion counter on Decree of Silence. If there are three or more depletion counters on Decree of Silence, sacrifice it.
Cycling {4}{U}{U} ({4}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Silence, you may counter target spell.

name: Dedicated Martyr
text: {W}, Sacrifice Dedicated Martyr: You gain 3 life.

editions.flavor:
"If he's so willing to suffer for his cause, then by all means, let us oblige him."
—Cabal Patriarch

name: Deep Analysis
text:
Target player draws two cards.
Flashback—{1}{U}, Pay 3 life. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: "The specimen seems to be broken."
"The specimen seems to be broken."
"No fact escapes me. Why do you think you can?"
"The specimen seems to be broken."
"The specimen seems to be broken."

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor: "No fact escapes me. Why do you think you can?"

name: Deepcavern Imp
text:
Flying, haste
Echo—Discard a card. (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

name: Deepchannel Mentor
text: Blue creatures you control can't be blocked.

editions.flavor: The rivers can no longer provide safe passage for travelers and commerce. They serve only as highways for raiders and channels for blood and woe.

name: Deepfathom Skulker
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
{3}{C}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

name: Deepfire Elemental
text: {X}{X}{1}: Destroy target artifact or creature with converted mana cost X.

editions.flavor:
"There are deep, deep places in this world that have long burned hot with little regard for the whitening of the earth's thin skin."
—Sek'Kuar, Deathkeeper

"There are deep, deep places in this world that have long burned hot with little regard for the whitening of the earth's thin skin."
—Sek'Kuar, Deathkeeper

name: Deepglow Skate
text: When Deepglow Skate enters the battlefield, double the number of each kind of counter on any number of target permanents.

editions.flavor: Its graceful glide paints the ocean floor with strokes of luminescence.

name: Deep Reconnaissance
text:
Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
Flashback {4}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Deep-Sea Kraken
text:
Deep-Sea Kraken can't be blocked.
Suspend 9—{2}{U} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {2}{U} and exile it with nine time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, if Deep-Sea Kraken is suspended, remove a time counter from it.

editions.flavor: The rift remained open for days, sluicing ancient seawater. It closed only after the last great tentacle squirmed its way through.

name: Deep-Sea Serpent
text: Deep-Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

editions.flavor: Sailors fear the deep-sea serpent; others thank the gods it has no legs.

name: Deep-Sea Terror
text: Deep-Sea Terror can't attack unless there are seven or more cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: After stripping the sunken ships, it rises to the surface for another helping.

name: Deep-Slumber Titan
text:
Deep-Slumber Titan enters the battlefield tapped.
Deep-Slumber Titan doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever Deep-Slumber Titan is dealt damage, untap it.

editions.flavor: Do not disturb.

name: Deep Spawn
text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Deep Spawn unless you put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
{U}: Deep Spawn gains shroud until end of turn and doesn't untap during your next untap step. Tap Deep Spawn. (A creature with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

name: Deeptread Merrow
text: {U}: Deeptread Merrow gains islandwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

editions.flavor: "My success at navigating the Dark Meanders irritates the Inkfathom school. They consider themselves peerless divers, but I try to remind them that they cannot own commodities like bravery and cunning."

name: Deep Water
text: {U}: Until end of turn, if you tap a land you control for mana, it produces {U} instead of any other type.

name: Deepwater Hypnotist
text: Inspired — Whenever Deepwater Hypnotist becomes untapped, target creature an opponent controls gets -3/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Watch the waves too long, and you may never look away."
—Meletian proverb

name: Deep Wood
text:
Cast Deep Wood only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures.

name: Deepwood Drummer
text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: His drums echo Deepwood's heartbeat.

name: Deepwood Elder
text: {X}{G}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: X target lands become Forests until end of turn.

editions.flavor: They'd guarded the Henge so long that they were as attuned to the powerstones as they were to the trees.

name: Deepwood Ghoul
text: Pay 2 life: Regenerate Deepwood Ghoul.

editions.flavor: They feed on the living to stay undead.
They feed on the living to stay undead.

name: Deepwood Legate
text:
If an opponent controls a Forest and you control a Swamp, you may cast Deepwood Legate without paying its mana cost.
{B}: Deepwood Legate gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Deepwood Tantiv
text: Whenever Deepwood Tantiv becomes blocked, you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: A single tantiv is just as dangerous as a herd.

name: Deepwood Wolverine
text: Whenever Deepwood Wolverine becomes blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The jhovalls are depleting its food sources, the Mercadians are eroding its home, and you're wondering why it's angry?

name: Defang
text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature.

editions.flavor: Once vampires are disarmed, they're given wooden swords and forced to assist in the training of Midnight Duelists.

name: Defeat
text: Destroy target creature with power 2 or less.

editions.flavor:
"Wars are decided one life at a time."
—Gvar Barzeel, Kolaghan warrior

name: Defender en-Vec
text:
Fading 4 (This creature enters the battlefield with four fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Defender en-Vec: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

name: Defender of Chaos
text:
Flash
Protection from white

editions.flavor: Some knights will not follow orders—only disorder.

name: Defender of Law
text:
Flash
Protection from red

editions.flavor: "It is not my place to question Radiant's rule. I exist to enforce her will."

name: Defender of the Order
text:
Morph {W}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Defender of the Order is turned face up, creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.

name: Defend the Hearth
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to players this turn.

editions.flavor: The defenders said not a word. Their shields, spears, and stances were warning enough.

name: Defense Grid
text: Each spell costs {3} more to cast except during its controller's turn.

editions.flavor:
"We've managed to keep the goblins in their assigned areas, but there's little we can do about the smell."
—Whip Tongue, viashino technician
It lights up the sky, beckoning enemies only to repel them.

"Woven together, strands of aether can form a mesh of surprising stability, though such a network tends to pull power from nearby devices."
—Consulate engineer's log

"A good deal of tyranny goes by the name of protection."
—Crystal Eastman,
"Equality or Protection"

name: Defense of the Heart
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls three or more creatures, sacrifice Defense of the Heart, search your library for up to two creature cards, and put those cards onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Defensive Formation
text: Rather than the attacking player, you assign the combat damage of each creature attacking you. You can divide that creature's combat damage as you choose among any of the creatures blocking it.

editions.flavor:
"Your enemies will pound upon the door of your defenses, but only you shall have the key, and it is the key of life."
—Song of All, canto 873

name: Defensive Maneuvers
text: Creatures of the creature type of your choice get +0/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Only on the battlefield can we repay all the Order has given us."

name: Defensive Stance
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/+1.

editions.flavor:
"It isn't for fighting. It's for when the fighting's gone bad."
—Kara Vrist, Mirran resistance

name: Defiant Bloodlord
text:
Flying
Whenever you gain life, target opponent loses that much life.

editions.flavor:
"Despite their bravado, mortals are fragile. If Zendikar is to endure, its lords must save it."
—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief

"Despite their bravado, mortals are fragile. If Zendikar is to endure, its lords must save it."
—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief
"Despite their bravado, mortals are fragile. If Zendikar is to endure, its lords must save it."—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief

name: Defiant Elf
text: Trample

editions.flavor: "I lost one home when Yavimaya was destroyed. I will not lose another."

name: Defiant Falcon
text:
Flying
{4}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Defiant Ogre
text:
When Defiant Ogre enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Defiant Ogre.
• Destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor: "I have no clan, but I still have purpose."

name: Defiant Salvager
text: Sacrifice an artifact or creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Defiant Salvager. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: "I didn't survive that crash just so I could fall to the likes of you."

name: Defiant Stand
text:
Cast Defiant Stand only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Target creature gets +1/+3 until end of turn. Untap that creature.

name: Defiant Strike
text:
Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Stand where the whole battle can see you. Strike so they'll never forget."
—Anafenza, khan of the Abzan

name: Defiant Vanguard
text:
When Defiant Vanguard blocks, at end of combat, destroy it and all creatures it blocked this turn.
{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 4 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Defiler of Souls
text:
Flying
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a monocolored creature.

editions.flavor:
"Stray not into sin, lest you face the doorman of an insatiable tomb."
—Prayer of Asha

name: Defiling Tears
text: Until end of turn, target creature becomes black, gets +1/-1, and gains "{B}: Regenerate this creature."

editions.flavor: Serra's living warriors looked on in horror. "Where is our Lady now?" they cried.

name: Deflecting Palm
text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. If damage is prevented this way, Deflecting Palm deals that much damage to that source's controller.

name: Deflection
text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.

editions.flavor:
Up and down,
over and through,
back around—
the joke's on you.

Up and down,
over and through,
back around—
the joke's on you.

"You've thrown your net at the wrong fish."
—The Lord of Atlantis
The golden rule of revenge: Do unto others what they tried to do unto you.

Up and down,
over and through,
back around—
the joke's on you.

name: Deftblade Elite
text:
Provoke (Whenever this creature attacks, you may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.)
{1}{W}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Deftblade Elite this turn.

name: Deft Dismissal
text: Deft Dismissal deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target attacking or blocking creatures.

editions.flavor:
"With spy thopters all around, how can the consuls be so blind to Tezzeret's manipulations?"
—Gideon Jura

name: Deft Duelist
text:
First strike
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: Some Serul Cove rogues traffic in stolen sigils, which fetch a high price from those who would rather pay for honor than earn it.

name: Defy Death
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If it's an Angel, put two +1/+1 counters on it.

editions.flavor: Gisela cornered the murderous demon among the graves of the dead villagers. "A fitting end," she murmured as she raised her sword.

name: Defy Gravity
text:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Flashback {U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: Magical or not, it's still a cloud.

name: Dega Disciple
text:
{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
{R}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "There is no true equity of power. There is only more and less."

name: Dega Sanctuary
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a black or red permanent, you gain 2 life. If you control a black permanent and a red permanent, you gain 4 life instead.

name: Degavolver
text:
Kicker {1}{B} and/or {R} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} and/or {R} as you cast this spell.)
If Degavolver was kicked with its {1}{B} kicker, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with "Pay 3 life: Regenerate Degavolver."
If Degavolver was kicked with its {R} kicker, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it and with first strike.

name: Deglamer
text: Choose target artifact or enchantment. Its owner shuffles it into his or her library.

editions.flavor: The more pleasant an illusion's garb, the more indecent its form laid bare.

name: Dehydration
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

editions.flavor:
"You say Saprazzo is a city built on water? I hope they have enough to wash the dust from my throat."
—Sisay

"Cry to the sun and watch as even your tears forsake you."
—Acolyte of Marit Lage
The viashino used the spell to dry foods for crossing the Great Desert. The Suq'Ata later discovered its use in war.

name: Deicide
text: Exile target enchantment. If the exiled card is a God card, search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with the same name as that card and exile them, then that player shuffles his or her library.

editions.flavor:
"It is done."
—Elspeth

name: Deity of Scars
text:
Trample
Deity of Scars enters the battlefield with two -1/-1 counters on it.
{B/G}, Remove a -1/-1 counter from Deity of Scars: Regenerate Deity of Scars.

editions.flavor:
"His skin cuts swords."
—The Seer's Parables

name: Déjà Vu
text: Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: The past is a mirror of the future.
History is the study of repetition.

name: Delay
text: Counter target spell. If the spell is countered this way, exile it with three time counters on it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard. If it doesn't have suspend, it gains suspend. (At the beginning of its owner's upkeep, remove a time counter from that card. When the last is removed, the player plays it without paying its mana cost. If it's a creature, it has haste.)

name: Delaying Shield
text:
If damage would be dealt to you, put that many delay counters on Delaying Shield instead.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove all delay counters from Delaying Shield. For each delay counter removed this way, you lose 1 life unless you pay {1}{W}.

name: Delif's Cone
text: {T}, Sacrifice Delif's Cone: This turn, when target creature you control attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain life equal to its power. If you do, it assigns no combat damage this turn.

editions.flavor: "Where is it written that beasts must cause pain?" —Delif, Ponderings

name: Delif's Cube
text:
{2}, {T}: This turn, when target creature you control attacks and isn't blocked, it assigns no combat damage this turn and you put a cube counter on Delif's Cube.
{2}, Remove a cube counter from Delif's Cube: Regenerate target creature.

name: Delirium
text:
Cast Delirium only during an opponent's turn.
Tap target creature that player controls. That creature deals damage equal to its power to the player. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by the creature this turn.

name: Delirium Skeins
text: Each player discards three cards.

editions.flavor: There came a rush, a sudden fire in the mind. Then the two saw only the sooty fog of madness, heard only the crackling of their last thoughts burning away.

name: Deliver
text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

name: Delraich
text:
Trample
You may sacrifice three black creatures rather than pay Delraich's mana cost.

editions.flavor: It wears the souls of its victims like jewels on a chain.

name: Deluge
text: Tap all creatures without flying.

editions.flavor:

"From the sea came all life, and to the sea it will return. The sooner the better."

text:

When Delusions of Mediocrity leaves the battlefield, you lose 10 life.

editions.flavor: When nothing but second best will do.
When nothing but second best will do.

text: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may reveal that card. If an instant or sorcery card is revealed this way, transform Delver of Secrets.

text: Search your library for a multicolored card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

text:

editions.flavor:

Flying, haste
